intro: Deuterocohnia strobilifera var. strobilifera, commonly known as the clustered cushion plant, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family native to South America. It is a small, low-growing perennial that forms dense, compact rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, cone-shaped inflorescences that are typically red or orange, adding visual interest to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its unique form and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in rock gardens or as a houseplant.
